com.fortify.util.rest.query

Class AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder<ConnType extends IRestConnection,T extends AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder<ConnType,T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fortify.util.rest.query.AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder<ConnType,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    ConnType - Concrete IRestConnection type
    T - Concrete type of this class
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractFoDEntityQueryBuilder, AbstractSSCEntityQueryBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder<ConnType extends IRestConnection,T extends AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder<ConnType,T>>
extends Object

    This abstract class allows for configuring an AbstractRestConnectionQuery instance for a specific query. Usually for each target system query endpoint, you would have a corresponding concrete implementation of this class, that allows for configuring the endpoint details like target path and any query parameters.

    The common class structure looks as follows:

    • AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder
      • AbstractMySystemQueryBuilder
        Specifies connection type and adds method public MySystemRestConnectionQuery build() {return new MySystemRestConnectionQuery(this);}
        • MySystemEndpoint1QueryBuilder
        • MySystemEndpoint2QueryBuilder

    This allows clients of your API to execute queries like this: new MySystemEndpoint1QueryBuilder(conn, requiredProperty1, ...).criteria1(value).criteria2(value).build().getAll() Usually constructing the QueryBuilder instances is not left to API consumers, but the system-specific API provides methods like querySomething(requiredProperty1, ...) that construct and return the corresponding QueryBuilder instance. As such, API consumers would do something like this: api.querySomething(requiredProperty1, ...).criteria1(value).criteria2(value).build().getAll()

    Concrete implementations of this class can utilize various functionality provided by this base class, and the com.fortify.util.rest.webtarget package to generate requests based on configurable search criteria. See for example the SSC REST client code for examples.

    Author:
    Ruud Senden
